com.kontakt.sdk.android.ble.connection

Interface KontaktDeviceConnection


  • public interface KontaktDeviceConnection
    KontaktDeviceConnection connection allows to establish connection with beacon.
    Since firmware in version 4.0 device does not to have setup password, but below it still needs set password

    All operation with device should be as quick as possible. You should not open connection and wait long time before taking any action. After doing job connection should be closed immediately

    • Nested Class Summary

      static interface  KontaktDeviceConnection.ConnectionListener

    • Method Detail

      • applyConfig

        void applyConfig(Config config,
                 WriteBatchListener<Config> writeBatchListener)
        Applies pending configuration (Config) for Device.
        It is possible to encounter problems during batch (the Config in this case) write operation which result in launching error handle callback method. Once the write batch operation fails, the Write Batch Processor will attempt performing rollback write batch operation aiming at restoring original Beacon configuration. The rollback operation however may not succeed as well leaving Beacon device changed partially. Therefore it is strongly advisable to write batches in relatively close distance to Beacon device. Thus, the risk of leaving Beacon in unspecified state may be avoided.
        The method is synchronized.



        Throws IllegalOperationException if provided RemoteBluetoothDevice is in version 4.0 or higher
        Parameters:
        config - the config
        writeBatchListener - the write batch listener

      • acceptProfile

        void acceptProfile(Preset profile,
                   WriteBatchListener<Preset> writeBatchListener)
        Accepts predefined profile (Preset) and changes parameters for Beacon.
        It is possible to encounter problems during batch (the Preset in this case) write operation which result in launching error handle callback method. Once the write batch operation failes, the Write Batch Processor will attempt performing rollback write batch operation aiming at restoring original Beacon configuration. The rollback operation however may not succeed as well leaving Beacon device changed partially. Therefore it is strongly advisable to write batches in relatively close distance to Beacon device. Thus, the risk of leaving Beacon in unspecified state may be avoided.
        The method is synchronized.

        Throws IllegalOperationException if provided RemoteBluetoothDevice is in version 4.0 or higher
        Parameters:
        profile - the profile
        writeBatchListener - the write batch listener

      • overwriteMinor

        void overwriteMinor(int value,
                    WriteListener writeListener)
        Writes minor value. The method is synchronized.

        Throws IllegalOperationException if provided RemoteBluetoothDevice is in version 4.0 or higher
        Parameters:
        value - the value
        writeListener - the write listener

      • enableNonConnectableMode

        void enableNonConnectableMode(java.lang.String masterPassword,
                              WriteListener writeListener)
        Changes Device mode to non-connectable. During the non-connectable mode no connection can be established with the Device for about 20 minutes.
        The non-connectable mode is also enabled when authentication failure occured because of providing wrong password.
        Device Master Password can be obtained via REST Client. The result callback is invoked by WriteListener.
        For more information concerning Device master password, see Credentials model (Credentials)
        The method is synchronized.

        Throws IllegalOperationException if provided RemoteBluetoothDevice is in version 4.0 or higher
        Parameters:
        masterPassword - the beacon master password
        writeListener - the write listener

      • overwriteMajor

        void overwriteMajor(int value,
                    WriteListener writeListener)
        Changes Beacon major value. The result callback is invoked by WriteListener.
        The method is synchronized.

        Throws IllegalOperationException if provided RemoteBluetoothDevice is in version 4.0 or higher
        Parameters:
        value - new value
        writeListener - the write listener

      • overwriteProximityUUID

        void overwriteProximityUUID(java.util.UUID proximity,
                            WriteListener writeListener)
        Changes Beacon Proximity UUID value. The result callback is invoked by WriteListener.
        The method is synchronized.

        Throws IllegalOperationException if provided RemoteBluetoothDevice is in version 4.0 or higher
        Parameters:
        proximity - the proximity UUID
        writeListener - the write listener

      • overwritePassword

        void overwritePassword(java.lang.String newPassword,
                       WriteListener writeListener)
        Changes beacon password. The password must be 4-byte long. For more information see kontakt.io Datasheet - version 2.0. The result callback is invoked by WriteListener.
        The method is synchronized.

        Throws IllegalOperationException if provided RemoteBluetoothDevice is in version 4.0 or higher
        Parameters:
        newPassword - the new password
        writeListener - the write listener
        See Also:
        kontakt.io Beacon Datasheet - version 2.0

      • overwriteModelName

        void overwriteModelName(java.lang.String newModelName,
                        WriteListener writeListener)
        Changes Beacon model name. The name should be no longer than sequence of 15 bytes (15 ASCII characters). For more information see kontakt.io Datasheet - version 2.0. The result callback is invoked by WriteListener.
        The method is synchronized.

        Throws IllegalOperationException if provided RemoteBluetoothDevice is in version 4.0 or higher
        Parameters:
        newModelName - the new model name
        writeListener - the write listener
        See Also:
        kontakt.io Beacon Datasheet - version 2.0

      • overwriteAdvertisingInterval

        void overwriteAdvertisingInterval(long millis,
                                  WriteListener writeListener)
        Changes Beacon advertising interval. The interval value is accepted in milliseconds and must be within [20 - 10240] ms range.
        The method is synchronized.

        Throws IllegalOperationException if provided RemoteBluetoothDevice is in version 4.0 or higher
        Parameters:
        millis - the interval millis
        writeListener - the write listener

      • overwritePowerLevel

        void overwritePowerLevel(int powerLevel,
                         WriteListener writeListener)
        Changes Beacon power level. The Power level is described by 8 levels where 0 is the lowest (default) and 7 is the highest. For more information see kontakt.io Datasheet - version 2.0.
        The result callback is invoked by WriteListener.
        The method is synchronized.

        Throws IllegalOperationException if provided RemoteBluetoothDevice is in version 4.0 or higher
        Parameters:
        powerLevel - the power level
        writeListener - the write listener
        See Also:
        kontakt.io Beacon Datasheet - version 2.0.

      • switchToDeviceProfile

        void switchToDeviceProfile(DeviceProfile deviceProfile,
                           WriteListener writeListener)
        Switch to device profile.

        Throws IllegalOperationException if provided RemoteBluetoothDevice is in version 4.0 or higher
        Parameters:
        deviceProfile - the device profile
        writeListener - the write listener

      • resetDevice

        void resetDevice(WriteListener writeListener)
        Resets device so that connection is established once again.
        For more information see kontakt.io Datasheet - version 2.0.
        The result callback is invoked by WriteListener.
        The method is synchronized.

        Throws IllegalOperationException if provided RemoteBluetoothDevice is in version 4.0 or higher
        Parameters:
        writeListener - the write listener
        See Also:
        kontakt.io Beacon Datasheet - version 2.0.

        Throws IllegalOperationException if provided RemoteBluetoothDevice is in version 4.0 or higher
        Parameters:
        masterPassword - the master password
        writeListener - the write listener

        Parameters:

        writeListener - the write listener

      • restoreDefaultSettings

        void restoreDefaultSettings(java.lang.String masterPassword,
                            WriteListener writeListener)
        Restores default Beacon settings. As an argument, 6-byte long Beacon master password must be provided. The master password can be obtained via API Client.
        The method is synchronized.

        Throws IllegalOperationException if provided RemoteBluetoothDevice is in version 4.0 or higher
        Parameters:
        masterPassword - the master password
        writeListener - the write listener
        See Also:
        kontakt.io Beacon Datasheet - version 2.0.

      • authorize

        void authorize(AuthToken token,
               AuthorizationCallback callback)
        Authorizes with beacon. Authorization is required before certain operations conducted on beacons with firmware 4.0 or higher and beacons pro.
        These operations are:
        - readTime(ReadListener)
        - readLightSensor(ReadListener)
        Parameters:
        token - AuthToken instance required for authorization.
        callback - Authorization result callback.

      • readAll

        void readAll(AuthToken token,
             ReadListener<Config> listener)
        Operation that returns beacon's current configuration wrapped in a Config object.
        Successful read all operation is equal to successful authorization operation authorize(AuthToken, AuthorizationCallback).

        Only available for beacons with firmware 4.0 or higher and beacons pro.
        Parameters:
        token - AuthToken instance.
        listener - Read listener.

      • readTime

        void readTime(ReadListener<Time> listener)
        Operation that returns current UTC time on a device.
        Only available for beacons pro.
        Authorization is required before this operation. See authorize(AuthToken, AuthorizationCallback)
        Parameters:
        listener - Read listener

      • readLightSensor

        void readLightSensor(ReadListener<java.lang.Integer> listener)
        Operation that returns current light sensor reading on a device. Unit: 0 to 100 %
        Only available for Beacons Pro with firmware 1.7 or higher.
        Reading light sensor is based on characteristic notification so after using this method a sensor reading will be received continuously every 0.5 of a second. Authorization is required before this operation. See authorize(AuthToken, AuthorizationCallback)
        Parameters:
        listener - Read listener

      • applySecureConfig

        void applySecureConfig(java.lang.String encryptedConfig,
                       WriteListener writeListener)
        Method for writing secure config. Accessible for device with firmware 4.0 and above and Beacon Pro

        Throws IllegalOperationException if provided device's firmware does not support this operation *

      • applySecureConfig

        void applySecureConfig(Config config,
                       AuthToken token,
                       WriteListener writeListener)
        Method for writing secure config offline. Accessible for devices with firmware 4.0 or higher and Beacon Pro
        WARNING: This is an advanced feature that should not be used in normal situations. By applying offline secure configs you accept the fact that the beacon might be desynchronized with Kontakt Cloud.

        Throws IllegalOperationException if provided device's firmware does not support this operation
        Parameters:
        config - Config that is about to be applied.
        token - AuthToken token.
        writeListener - Operation listener

      • executeSecureCommand

        void executeSecureCommand(java.lang.String secureCommand,
                          WriteListener writeListener)
        Executes Secure Command.
        Parameters:
        secureCommand - String representing secure command.
        writeListener - Execution listener.

      • updateFirmware

        void updateFirmware(Firmware firmware,
                    KontaktCloud kontaktCloud,
                    FirmwareUpdateListener firmwareUpdateListener)
        Method for initializing firmware update for Kontakt.io devices with secure profile (for now: Beacon PRO only)
        Parameters:
        firmware - Firmware instance.
        kontaktCloud - KontaktCloud instance. This is required for Beacon authorization and downloading firmware file.
        firmwareUpdateListener - FirmwareUpdateListener instance. Listener that will report firmware update progress and errors.

      • updateFirmware

        void updateFirmware(Firmware firmware,
                    byte[] fileBytes,
                    KontaktCloud kontaktCloud,
                    FirmwareUpdateListener firmwareUpdateListener)
        Method for initializing firmware update for Kontakt.io devices with secure profile (for now: Beacon PRO only). This method should be used only uf you have pre-loaded byte array of valid firmware file.
        Parameters:
        firmware - Firmware instance.
        fileBytes - Firmware file bytes.
        kontaktCloud - KontaktCloud instance. This is required for Beacon authorization.
        firmwareUpdateListener - FirmwareUpdateListener instance. Listener that will report firmware update progress and errors.

      • syncTime

        void syncTime(WriteListener writeListener)
        Operation that synchronizes current UTC time with the beacon.
        Only available for beacons pro.
        Authorization is required before this operation. See authorize(AuthToken, AuthorizationCallback)
        Parameters:
        writeListener - Write listener (extra will always be null in this case)

      • getDevice

        RemoteBluetoothDevice getDevice()
        Gets beacon that the connection is established with.
        Returns:
        the iBeacon device.

      • connect

        boolean connect()
        Initializes connection to device provided in the KontaktDeviceConnection constructor.
        Returns:
        true, if the connection attempt was initiated successfully

      • connect

        boolean connect(RemoteBluetoothDevice remoteBluetoothDevice)
        Initializes connection to given device.
        Parameters:
        remoteBluetoothDevice - device to connect to.
        Returns:
        true, if the connection attempt was initiated successfully.

      • close

        void close()
        Closes Beacon connection releases provided resources. The method is synchronized.

      • isConnected

        boolean isConnected()
        Returns true if Connection with Beacon is established. The method is synchronized.
        Returns:
        the boolean flag indicating whether connection is established.

      • isAuthenticated

        boolean isAuthenticated()
        Returns true if Beacon was successfully authenticated. The method is synchronized.
        Returns:
        the boolean flag indicating whether beacon was authenticated.

      • isClosed

        boolean isClosed()
        Returns true if connection is closed.
        Returns:
        the boolean flag indicating whether connection is closed.
